utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: So you want me to explain how you just lost?

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Or do you wanna stare at the board your full... three minutes? Cling to hope?

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: C'mon. It's called speed chess.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Na-na na-na... na-na na-na... hey-hey-hey...

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: ... good-bye.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: Good game.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: I said "good game".

utterance.speaker: PROCTOR
utterance.content: Hey! Hey!

utterance.speaker: PROCTOR
utterance.content: Stop it! Stop that!

utterance.speaker: PROCTOR
utterance.content: Back away from him! Back away!

utterance.speaker: FEMALE PROCTOR
utterance.content: Call nine-one-one! Get an ambulance!

utterance.speaker: PROCTOR
utterance.content: Tell them to send two!

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: My head's gonna explode! Aaaah!

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Your head still hurt?

utterance.speaker: NICK
utterance.content: You a moron?

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: Nate.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: I'm clutching my head in pain, and he asks if it hurts? What are you, some kind of med student? You look like you still have theme birthday parties.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Any problems concentrating in school lately?

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Uh, besides the dreams of running my tongue along my French teacher's breasts? No, I'm doing quite great.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: The rage and pain could be caused by a parasite. Does he eat a lot of sushi?

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: No. Uh, he was a vegetarian until just a few months ago.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Any changes in behaviour since the new diet?

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: No. He's been this way since he became a teenager. It doesn't matter how much I yell or punish, he's still gonna say...

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Yeah, let's all shed a tear for poor little Nate's mother. Any more stupid questions?

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: Nate!

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I hate this... kid.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I like this kid.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You haven't met him.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I know you hate him. What more do I need to know? The kid's not a clich√©. Anybody can get into a fight after losing. It takes real creativity to beat up someone you just beat.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Pain's not limited to his head.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: The rest is bumps and bruises accounted for by the seventeen fights he's been in this semester.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Concussion?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: MRI was clean. No frontal lobe tumor. And the tox screen showed no trace of coke or amphetamines.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Nate went medieval on the other kid. Could be...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hold on. I'm having a moment. This... this could be Foreman's last time mistakenly suggesting adrenal gland tumor.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Which could create excess adrenaline. Causes the head pain and rage.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: But not the personality disorder.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: There is no personality disorder. He's a teenager.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Being a teenager excuses the odd inappropriate comment. This kid say anything appropriate? He's having cluster headaches. Probably been having them for years. Question is, what's causing them?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: If it were just a cluster headache, he'd have swelling around the eyes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: ER gave him ibuprofen for the pain. Useless for this pain. It could have knocked down the swelling. Best bet is a vascular problem.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Normal treatment for cluster headaches is steroids, which the ER also gave him. He's still in pain. Which means...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Normal treatment is called normal treatment because sometimes you have to use abnormal treatment. Start him on blood thinners and give his noggin Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Don't you dare... touch that acerbic wit.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Fifty bucks to whichever of you steps up and treats this brat.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Not the kid's fault, he's sick.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Fine! You do it.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: No way. He's your brat.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I'll do it. But I've got a job interview after work. Anything comes up later, you guys handle it.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Need a peer recommendation?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Cameron's should suffice.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: This isn't gonna turn me into some, like, drooling vegetable wets his pants, is it?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It's safe. The magnetic pulses activate nerve cells which will hopefully squelch the head pain.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Is there anything you can do about the other pain?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: From the fights?

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Yeah, I mean, my face, my shoulder, my stomach. I can barely bend my fingers.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You're already on pain meds. Nothing more I can do.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Sure you can, man. Tell your homies to quit stomping on me!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I'll get the word out that you're a great guy.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: So, do people watch what they say around you?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Because I'm black?

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: No, because you're gay.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Cluster headaches can persist for years, cause irritability or even hostility towards others.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: You mean, the illness is affecting his personality?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: If these treatments work, it could...

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: ... change him?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: Oh, thank God.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: Oh. Oh, you must think I'm awful. Here, my son's lying in a hospital bed and...

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I-I'm pretty sure I get it.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: I thought I was a bad mother. And I hated myself. Because I hated him.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What do you got for me this...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: ... fine morning?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Blood thinners and TMS had no effect. It's not cluster headaches.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You accusing the symptoms of lying?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Could be hemochromatosis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wouldn't account for the personality disorder.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: What about hypothyroidism?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's not getting aggressive and lethargic, he's getting aggressive and aggressiver.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: What about ruptured dermoid cyst?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sorry. Just got dizzy there. I was expecting to turn right. It's Foreman's turn to be shot down.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: The thing that Cameron said.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Way to think outside the box.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: But no fat in the ventricles. It's cluster headaches.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Normal treatment didn't work. Abnormal treatment didn't work.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good point, Foreman!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The treatments don't always work. Symptoms never lie.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: The only approved treatment left for cluster headaches is brain surgery. And that's not even a guarantee.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Back off, Foreman!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If the approved treatment doesn't work, we go with an unapproved treatment.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Something on your mind?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because you totally can't tell.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I had a job interview lined up at New York Mercy yesterday.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hospital for Manhattan's glitterati. Big coup. Your homies must be kvelling.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Didn't happen, because apparently I called to cancel. I don't remember making that call. You think I have neurological issue?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Why are you jerking me around?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It wasn't me.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Yeah! It was one of the other petty, socially repressed asses I work for.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Maybe it was Ashton Kutcher.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: If you want me to stay, tell me you want me to stay.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Would it matter?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No, but it'd be the adult way to handle it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If the adult way doesn't work, why bother with it?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I've been totally professional! Gave two weeks notice, continued to work cases! Scheduled my interviews on my own time! You have no right to screw with my future.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're gonna be all whiny during the differential diagnoses, aren't you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It wasn't me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I only sabotage people I consider worth it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You are one evil,... cunning woman. It's a massive turn-on.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You girls can gossip later.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You called New York Mercy to have Foreman's job interview killed.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: When I said, "You girls can gossip later," I was throwing you out, but in a polite way.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Well, I take it you're off your antidepressants.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Ah, you're deflecting. Only I'm allowed to do that.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Does Foreman actually think I did that?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, just me. But I know something he doesn't. I didn't do it.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Why would I do it?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Do you want him to leave?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Were you planning on doing something?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I'm waiting for board approval.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: But if he takes the job, there's nothing to be done. You had to stop him.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Wasn't me.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Looking for a tell. Rapid eye blink, twitch of the lips.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Send in Nurse Unger when you pass her on your way out.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh! Almost forgot. I need to give a sixteen-year-old magic mushrooms to treat a cluster headache. Is that cool?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Yeah, no problem.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I was being sarcastic.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wouldn't look that way in the court transcript. Mushrooms have psilocybins that work on cluster headaches. It's either that or cutting into his brain and going on a fishing expedition.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I assume you've considered he could have a psychogenic experience. Possibly suffer a fit of severe paranoia.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, I have now. Yeah, it's definitely better that the Dean of Medicine prescribes it instead of an unhinged doctor with a history of drug use. Takes the stink off if the patient decides to put on a cape and fly off the roof.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Low dose. No more than ten milligrams. Tightly controlled setting.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: And make sure the mother signs off on it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Party on, Garth. And don't stand in Foreman's way. It's just wrong.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: New research shows that a chemical component in the mushrooms can be...

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Yeah, lots of technical medical stuff. So, when do I get 'em?

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: I went to college. I know about mushrooms. A friend of a friend shot himself in the foot.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: They're not giving me a gun, Enid! Sign the consent form.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We'll be monitoring him, but cardiac arrest is possible.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Big E... small N...

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: And if... the mushrooms don't work?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: The next step would be a type of brain surgery.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Pain's gettin' worse! Need... 'shrooms... now!

utterance.speaker: CUE MUSIC
utterance.content: Iron Butterfly's "In-a-gadda-da-vida"

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Nate, how's the pain?

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Hey, hey!

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: It's Skippy, the bush kangaroo!

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Your head, Nate. We need to know how the pain is.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: What I got here... is the opposite of pain.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: That means you're suffering from cluster headaches. Which means, hopefully...

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Man, you're hot! She's making me horny.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Deal with it.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey, hey. You can't get me stoned, then not close the deal.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Take it easy. He's not well.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: You'll regret saying no. Check it out.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Oh, for God's sake.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Hold it.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: What're you doing?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He has undersized testes.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: His other secondary sexual characteristics are normal.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If you wanna curry favor with me, avoid discussions of other men's testicles.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Thanks. Focus on phrases like "You were right about the cluster headaches."

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: But wrong about what caused them. Vascular problem in a major artery wouldn't cause hypogonadism.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Okay, what causes rage, headaches, personality disorder and hypogonadism?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Where's Foreman?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's mad at me.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No reason.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yeah, that makes sense.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Male genitals are controlled by the hypothalamus and pituitary gland. We're not talking about Foreman anymore.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: The kid's being pummeled at school. A couple blows to the head could cause hypothalamic lesions. We ever gonna talk about what happens when Foreman's gone?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If this were an employee-owned airline in Scandinavia, yes. It's not lesions. His temperature would be all over the map. Symptoms don't lie.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He's gone in less than a week and you haven't even read a r√©sum√©?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Doesn't even need to. The two of us can handle it. Craniopharyngioma fits the symptoms.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Biopsy the brat's pituitary. And let the record show I was right about the cluster headaches.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Forget it!

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: It's a straightforward procedure. We thread an endoscopic tube through the nostril...

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: And cut something out of my brain? No way.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: If it's a tumor, it could kill you.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Just give me more 'shrooms, okay? I'll be fine.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: You only need my consent, right?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yeah, but it'll be a lot easier if he...

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: Do whatever you have to do.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: You don't touch me, all right? You can touch me. Just not my brain.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: Nate, you gotta do this. I can't take it anymore.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: My God, Mom! Save me the melodramatic hand-wringing, okay? Loosen up! Get yourself coited.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I'm gonna give him a sedative.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: You're decent-looking, Dr. Skippy.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Why don't you take her for a ride?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Nate...

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Are you in pain?

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: Nate!

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: His heart rate's normal. Respiration's even.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: What's happening? What's the matter with him?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: He's jaundiced. His liver's shutting down.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We started him on sodium polystyrene sulfonate.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: His liver's operating at about twenty percent and deteriorating fast.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Which means he'll be dead long before Foreman turns in his parking pass. So, what causes personality disorder, head pain, blah-blah-blah, and liver failure?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Liver failure can cause hypogonadism, head pain. Altered mental status leads to the personality disorder and rage. All we need to do is figure out what caused the liver failure.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes. Also, we need to figure out how symptoms yesterday can be caused by liver failure today.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: If his liver's failing now, it wasn't great yesterday. If it wasn't operating at capacity, it could have caused...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Ooh-aah! Whoa!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Don't sneak up on a person like that.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I'm listening.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, listening doesn't help me. Okay. Let's go with the liver and a time-machine theory. Foreman, what causes liver problems?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Wilson's disease.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: No. Ceruloplasmin's normal.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: No enlargement and no palpable mass, so no cancer.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Could be a narrowing of the bile ducts. Primary sclerosingcholangitis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Most liver damage begins with what we put in our bodies. Foreman?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Angry teen... alcohol.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: No. Blood tests were negative.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: No signs of drug use or acetaminophen poisoning in his tox screen. Maybe the water was contaminated.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: His mother would also be sick.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Cuddy?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sounded like someone with back. Go.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We'll try and muddle through without your blank stare to guide us. So if it's not the bad things he's putting in, what about the good things?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: He was raised a vegetarian.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Was raised. Means he's all grown up. Or he's not a vegetarian anymore.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: He started eating red meat a few months ago.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Would if he had an OTC deficiency. Body can't metabolize nitrogen, damages the liver. Run a hamburger test.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's exactly what it sounds like. Stuff him full of meat, wait for his ammonia levels to spike.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I'll double your salary.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Chase and Cameron would mutiny if they found out.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Chase and Cameron wouldn't be heading up their own diagnostic group. You'll work in parallel with House. It'll be your practice. Separate staff, separate cases. Complete autonomy.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I've only been doing this for three years.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Three years under House. No better training.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: And when that case comes along that I can't figure out? You know who I'd have to go to.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Or you can just let that patient die. That's completely up to you.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He's evil.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: He didn't sabotage your interview.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Because I did.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I didn't! You believed me - means you're not sure House did it.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Well, somebody did it. Somebody here did it. I can't work here.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: This isn't a medical procedure. This is just about Doogie making me eat garbage.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Need to see how your liver processes the proteins.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Then get me a steak, some roast beef.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: What if I brought him something from home?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: It has to be prepared here so we know there's no chemicals or preservatives that could affect the test results.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: I'm not eating anything prepared by five-dollar-an-hour immigrant hospital cooks in hairnets.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Shut up!

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Either you start eating, or I'm gonna strap you to this bed and shove these down your throat one-by-one, got it?

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Can't get mad at me. I'm sick. You're supposed to feel bad for me.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Nurse, full set of body restraints.

utterance.speaker: NURSE
utterance.content: Yes, doctor.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Trust me. It'll be a lot less messy if you do it yourself.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You killed Foreman's job interview.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Why would I...?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Somebody did. Wasn't me, and it wasn't House, which means it has to be somebody who thought he was protecting House. Which means it has to be somebody who actually likes House. Which means it's either you or the... weird night janitor who wears his pants backwards.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I want Foreman to leave.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: House has to realize he needs someone who stands up to him. Cameron's in love with him, Chase is afraid of him, and I enable him. House needs limits.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I give him...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You authorize magic mushrooms. House is a six-year-old who thinks he's better off without parents. A few tummy aches after dinners of ice cream and ketchup might do him some good.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You're lying.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: An enabler doesn't conspire against, an enabler enables.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You're paranoid.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You made that call. And because of that call, you basically guaranteed Foreman's out of here.

utterance.speaker: DOUG
utterance.content: I thought it would be fun to work on my boat with him.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And you went shirtless because... skin cancer looks cool.

utterance.speaker: DOUG
utterance.content: Well, I realize I got burnt.

utterance.speaker: DOUG
utterance.content: I'm not too worried about that. It's these white marks, you know?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Lie down.

utterance.speaker: DOUG
utterance.content: I mean, that boat has all sorts of, uh, lead paint, and there's... chemicals everywhere.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: When daddy works on his boat, does he have a cooler with lots of brown bottles with long necks?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And does daddy like to lie down on his boat and go nap-nap in the sun?

utterance.speaker: DOUG
utterance.content: Oh! What-what the hell?!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I will give you this for the... one dollar, forty one cents in your pocket.

utterance.speaker: DOUG
utterance.content: Wait, how could you know...?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: A psychic once told me that I'm psychic.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey, one of these quarters is Canadian. Give me back my syringe.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Hamburger stress test showed no change in his ammonia levels.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Liver's properly converting the ammonia into urea. He doesn't have OTC deficiency.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Welcome back.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Sorry. I shouldn't have been taking my problems out on the patient.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Or on me. Apology accepted. Starve him.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: And what are we looking for?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Diabetic steatosis would screw up his liver. Starve him overnight and see if his blood sugar pops.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We mess with his blood sugar, we could set off another rage.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not a problem. You can take him.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: I want something to eat!

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: Honey, please don't.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: NURSE
utterance.content: I was just trying to get a urine sample, and he went crazy.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: I need to eat!

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: You're not sticking anything else in me!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It's just a few more hours.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: You're gonna hurt yourself.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: I'm gonna hurt you!

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: As soon as we get a urine sample, we can leave you alone.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: You want your sample?! Here's your damn sample!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Nate, don't.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Nate, you need to get back into bed. Right now.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Chem panel and urinalysis confirms the bloody urine was caused by kidney failure.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He's on dialysis. He's gonna need it for the rest of his life.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Which is shortening as we speak. We are looking at a Chinese menu, and we've got symptoms from too many columns. They're going to overcharge us.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Multiple organ failure could mean primary HIV infection.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: That would mean someone agreed to sleep with him. Plus his serology is negative.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: His uric acid's slightly elevated.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Ten percent of males in this country have elevated...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So we're only gonna pay attention to _abnormal_ abnormalities?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We've been stuffing him with meat and his kidneys are shot. Of course his uric acid levels...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Could be hepatic fibrosis or MCADD. Brat's got a genetic disorder.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Get the sequencing primers. See if it's one of the ones we can treat.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I can draw some blood, but then I gotta run.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Job interview?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You gonna stop me if it is?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You do the nurse stuff, they'll do the doctor stuff.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: This a blood test for a marriage license? Plan on kidnapping me to Massachusetts... or Canad...

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: What did you give him? Are you treating him for something?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Sedative.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: Did he need a sedative?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I did. Just shutting him up so I can draw some of his blood in peace.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: You walked in with that. You didn't even give him a chance.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: People are what they are.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: He's sick. The rudeness isn't his fault.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: If he had tuberculosis, it wouldn't be his fault either. But I still wouldn't let him cough on me.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: The lab. We're testing our patient's blood for hereditary...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Cuddy thinks I sabotaged Foreman's interview. She's gonna fire me.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I don't believe it.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: She said it was unprofessional and...

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: No, I mean I literally don't believe it. Cuddy wouldn't fire you for something like that.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Which... means either she lied to you, or you're... lying to me.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You so would have fallen for that three years ago.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You were looking for a reaction. You were looking for me to feel bad for you. Save your skin. But how am I gonna save you? Unless... you think I'm the one who really did it.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Cuddy's logic was Foreman's valuable to House. I care about House. Ergo, I would do anything to save him.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: And your logic was... I care about House as much as you do, ergo...

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: It wasn't me. I don't care about House.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I don't believe you.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: No one does. House is nothing more than my boss. Foreman's nothing more than a colleague.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You're lying.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Everyone does. But it wasn't me.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: No markers for hepatic fibrosis. Nothing for MCADD.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Foreman's interview in New York got screwed up.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I heard.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Foreman thought it was House, House thought it was Cuddy. Cuddy thought it was Wilson, Wilson thought it was me.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: And you think it was me? God... you think I... sabotaged Foreman? I don't even want him here.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Then why would I do...?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I think you sabotaged Foreman just to sabotage Foreman.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: So everyone's a suspect because everyone wants to help House. Except for me. I'm a suspect because I'm a petty, vindictive jerk?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You actually think I would do something like that?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: It was someone.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: It wasn't me.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Negative for Von Gierke disease. And it's Tuesday.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I like you.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I know. See you next Tuesday.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Found something.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: He's got a partial HPRT enzyme deficiency. Means he could have Kelley-Seegmiller Syndrome.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: But it's a partial deficiency. So it may not be Kelley-Seegmiller.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes. Those are the two options. It is... or it isn't.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Kelley-Seegmiller explains the aggressive personality.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: If he had Kelley-Seegmiller, he wouldn't just be aggressive, he'd be self-mutilating. Chewing his lips, banging his head.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Lovely disease. Degenerative, fatal, incurable. I wonder if that's why Cameron's on the "not" side.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: That and the fact that symptoms don't lie.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Kelley-Seegmiller carriers self-mutilate when they're stressed.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He's in the ICU with a failing liver and no kidneys. Yeah, his life is sweet.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: His vegetarian diet could have limited the purines in his system, slowing the disease's progress.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So let's speed it up.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So you two kids will stop fighting. Also, I don't feel like waiting for respiratory failure. Chase, find some way for the mother to get lost for a while. I'm going to stress this kid until he bites off a finger.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: They move me to geriatrics? Who are you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Dr. McCaney. The man who's gonna kick your ass all over this chessboard.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I'm too weak to...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: ...bite yourself, yeah. You need some liquid energy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Now, if you consent, I'm gonna give you this shot of adrenaline.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Oww! I don't wanna play.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Aside from being indicative of pituitary issues and certain kinds of genetic disorders, small testicles also indicate... that you're a big chicken. Please don't make me do the sound effect.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: You're not gonna goad me into playing.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Didn't think I'd have to. Thought you'd just jump at the chance of humiliating someone.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Age before cripple. I'm white.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It... is... on!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Bird's opening. Passive approach.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sign of a coward.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Sicilian defense. Sign of an idiot.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Arrogance has to be earned.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Tell me what you've done to earn yours.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: I can walk.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't bleed out of my penis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Check.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You know, it's a real thin line between tortured genius and awkward kid who can't get girls because he's... creepy.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Why are you doing this?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: To stress you out.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Check.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Yeah, but why?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'd tell you, but I figure it's more stressful if you don't know why.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Not feeling too stressed.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You know that no one likes you, right?

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Yeah, well, anybody like you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're dying.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Check.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Your move.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Care to lay down your king?

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: You can't win. You can pin my queen. My knight to E7. Your king to H8. Sacrifice rook takes pawn. Bishop blocks. Queen to H5. Checkmate. Save what's left of your dignity. Lay down your king.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Crap.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's having a seizure. Four milligrams IV Lorazepam.

utterance.speaker: NURSE
utterance.content: Right away.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I hate this kid.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I like this kid.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You get the job?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: They're gonna let me know.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Kelley-Seegmiller didn't cause this seizure.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So we've got one more symptom, one less diagnosis. I assume they're gonna call for references? You give 'em my name?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No. Amyloidosis can cause seizures, and the protein buildup could cause organ failure.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Wouldn't alter his personality.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Whose name did you give?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: My last boss.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Ouch! That can't look good. I hate this kid.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: What if we're not dealing with one condition? What if it's multiple conditions?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Uh-uh, it's gotta be one. It's always one.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Nothing explains this constellation of symptoms. We've gotta be missing something. Maybe the kid lied about some medication. Maybe he's hiding something.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Why would he be hiding something?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I don't know, because he's... evil?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What if he is? What if the symptoms lied?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There. Now all we're looking at is a simple, evil jerk with amyloidosis.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You're not being objective.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Amyloidosis was your idea.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You were right, it doesn't fit the symptoms.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah, it does. Look.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You crossed it off because you wanna hate the kid. And you can't hate him if he's a victim...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You want him to be a victim because you wanna believe that people are good. And if they're not, it's gotta be a chemical problem. Except they're not, and it's not. Flush him with immunosuppressants. Get a biopsy to confirm, and find him a marrow donor.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: What will happen to him?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Substances called amyloid proteins build up in the body's organs, shutting them down. It's a fairly rare disease. And I'm afraid it can be fatal.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: So do you operate or something to take them out?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: He needs a bone marrow transplant. Dr. Cameron is searching the donor bank. We should test you as well.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: When you first told me he was sick, I was... happy. Relieved. Now...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Nate, I'm gonna take a small piece of nerve from your ankle. Let me know if you feel any pain.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: I'm burning up. Couldn't you just knock me out like you did last time?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Wish I could. But your body has to be clear so it's ready for a marrow transplant.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Hey, Dr. X.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: I know you've busted ass trying to save me.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It's all right.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: I wasn't gonna thank you. I was gonna tell you you really suck at this.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We're doing our best.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: That's sort of my point. Your best really sucks.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Nerve biopsy was clean. No evidence of amyloidosis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It was your idea. Don't give up on it so fast.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He's running a fever. If it's two conditions, one of them's gotta be an infection. We should start him on antibiotics, see what clears up, what doesn't.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Is he having trouble breathing?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Yeah, he has mucus in his chest from an infection.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Could also be an amyloid buildup. Keep him on immunosuppressants and biopsy somewhere else, his sinuses.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Look, you got two choices. Engage me in a futile argument then do what I asked, or just do what I asked.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're not ready.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There was a third choice. Don't do what I asked. You coulda defied me, stuck the kid on antibiotics. But you didn't. Because you still trust my judgment more than your own.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You sabotaged Foreman's job interview, didn't you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Foreman's already been over this. It wasn't me.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Everybody's chasing ghosts over this. Which means either nobody did it, or somebody wants everybody chasing ghosts. Now, who does that sound like?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And why would I do that?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Because as long as Foreman thought you were guilty, he was gonna be useless around here.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You know, sometimes I forget why I hired you.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You cost him a good opportunity and gained nothing.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I cost him a crappy opportunity. New York Mercy's where you go to treat boils and cysts and build a 401K.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: If you want him to stay, tell him.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't and there'd be no point.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You do. And the point would be to make him feel like he's wanted.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He doesn't need that.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: All right, then. It'd make him feel like maybe you weren't evil.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: He needs that.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Talk to Foreman.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We dumped one symptom. But forgot to add one.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Revenge time, Nate.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: Are you...?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes! I am. Black or white?

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: Just limp away.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: He doesn't wanna play. Leave him alone.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Pick one, or... this comes out. And, for all you know, this is really important.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: Stop it!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That hurts, right? Which is odd, because I'm really enjoying this. You hold the pieces that way because you can't bend your thumb.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because your bones have formed abnormally. Thanks to all the crap that's been pushing its way in between them.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Actually, this stuff isn't important at all.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: Your doctors said he needs immunosuppressants.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: They're idiots. It's not amyloidosis. It's iron. He's got hemochromatosis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The body absorbs iron from food, but can't process it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Can't get rid of it. And idle iron is the devil's playground. It builds up in the organs and joints, whacking them in the process.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Caused all of the symptoms. Including something that wasn't a symptom.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Those body aches, they were not from the fighting.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: His personality issues?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sorry. The iron's innocent on that count. Your kid's a jerk.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And, yeah, it's probably your fault. Although, if you'd stayed off the meat like your mom said, you'd have half as much iron, and be twice less... almost dead.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, nurse!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: This patient is bleeding for some reason.

utterance.speaker: ENID
utterance.content: Is he going to be okay?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He'll need dialysis. And he'll have to get his blood drained every few months for the rest of his life. My condolences. It's going to be a long and annoying life.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I wouldn't have taken your bishop. I'd have moved my queen to D6, defusing the threat. Then rook to E8, attacking the king's pawn. I'd have lost the exchange, but won the game.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: NATE
utterance.content: I was bluffing. And that's why... you lost.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Jerk.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You just here to watch, or you got something to say?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Still running the new biopsy for amyloidosis?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Still nothing.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Run the test again. Recheck your results.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Looks like you're in for an all-nighter.
